publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1076 Ian Jenkins: European Year of Languages—That the Parliament welcomes the designation of 2001 as "European Year of Languages"; further welcomes the year’s aim of celebrating Europe’s linguistic heritage and promoting language learning; notes that individual member states decide which languages should be included; recognises the high prestige in which the Gaelic and Scots languages are held internationally, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to have Scots and Gaelic designated as eligible for this important project. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-1076 European Year of Languages (lodged on 30 June 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1076 European Year of Languages (lodged on 30 June 2000) Christine Grahame*

S1M-1076 Ian Jenkins: European Year of Languages-That the Parliament welcomes the designation of 2001 as "European Year of Languages"; further welcomes the year's aim of celebrating Europe's linguistic heritage and promoting language learning; notes that individual member states decide which languages should be included; recognises the high prestige in which the Gaelic and Scots languages are held internationally, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to have Scots and Gaelic designated as eligible for this important project. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-1076 European Year of Languages (lodged on 30 June 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1076 European Year of Languages (lodged on 30 June 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-1076 European Year of Languages (lodged on 30 June 2000) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1076 Ian Jenkins: European Year of Languages-That the Parliament welcomes the designation of 2001 as "European Year of Languages"; further welcomes the year's aim of celebrating Europe's linguistic heritage and promoting language learning; notes that individual member states decide which languages should be included; recognises the high prestige in which the Gaelic and Scots languages are held internationally, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to have Scots and Gaelic designated as eligible for this important project. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Margaret Jamieson, Fergus Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod

S1M-1076 Ian Jenkins: European Year of Languages-That the Parliament welcomes the designation of 2001 as "European Year of Languages"; further welcomes the year's aim of celebrating Europe's linguistic heritage and promoting language learning; notes that individual member states decide which languages should be included; recognises the high prestige in which the Gaelic and Scots languages are held internationally, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to have Scots and Gaelic designated as eligible for this important project. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Margaret Jamieson, Fergus Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White*
